item.title: Shell Shortcut
item.description: Some useful bash shortcut for me. key method Ctrl + a Move to the beginning of the line Ctrl + e Move to the end of the line Ctrl + u (bash) Clear the characters on the line before the current cursor position Ctrl + u (zsh) If you’re using the zsh, this will clear the entire line Ctrl + k Clear the characters on the line after the current cursor position Ctrl + w Delete the word in front of the cursor Ctrl + r Search history Ctrl + g Escape from search mode Ctrl + - Undo the last change Ctrl + s Stop output to screen Ctrl + q Re-enable screen output Ctrl + c Terminate/kill current foreground process Ctrl + z Suspend/stop current foreground process Alt + d Delete the word after the cursor Ctrl + l Clear screen Ctrl + j Sent Enter Ctrl + j Delete one charater before cursor
